i200503300500

Got the following entry silently add to the log. Error message does not help at
all in finding what plug-in manifest had the problem. 

Code is in PluginParser.logStatus(SAXException).

!MESSAGE Error parsing manifest: Content is not allowed in prolog.

We should fix this or close as wontfix.  This seem less important now that most bundles have moved to bundle manifests.  Thoughts?

If you want to close, I am fine with that, but there would be two easy ways of fixing this: pass the plugin manifest location to the PluginParser so it can be shown when logging errors, or just re-throw the SAXParserException in PluginParser.error(). That will abort the parsing (which makes sense anyway). The converter will catch that exception (it catches any exception) and produce a suitable message. I like this one better.
+1 this should be easy to fix.
PluginConverter is old news, everyone should be using bundle manifests by now.

traces.message: Content is not allowed in prolog.
